org.jgrapes.io.util

Class ByteBufferOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • org.jgrapes.io.util.ByteBufferOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class ByteBufferOutputStream
extends java.io.OutputStream
    An OutputStream that is backed by ByteBuffers obtained from a queue. When a byte buffer is full, a Output event (default) is generated and a new buffer is fetched from the queue.
    Author:
    Michael N. Lipp

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteBufferOutputStream(IOSubchannel channel, EventPipeline eventPipeline)
      Creates a new instance that uses Output events to dispatch buffers.

      Creates a new instance.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Calls flush() and fires an Eos event.
      void flush()
      Creates and fires a Output event with the buffer being filled and obtains a new buffer from the queue.

      • ByteBufferOutputStream

        public ByteBufferOutputStream(IOSubchannel channel,
                              EventPipeline eventPipeline,
                              boolean inputMode)
                       throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel to fire events on
        eventPipeline - the event pipeline used for firing events
        inputMode - if true use Input events to dispatch buffers
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current is interrupted while trying to get a new buffer from the queue
